intro: Tithymalus repetitus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and flies, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
